decision_conditions: <p>The proposed development, by reason of lack of a contribution towards the provision of affordable housing, would fail to adequately contribute towards the provision of mixed and balanced communities and housing need in the local area. As such, the development would not be consistent with Policies H4 and H5 of the London Plan (2021), Hackney Local Plan Policies LP12, LP13 and NPPF (2024) paragraph 63 and the Hackney S106 Planning Contributions Supplementary Planning Document (2020).</p>

<p>The proposal, by reason of the inappropriate access arrangements and lack of suitable outlook, would provide a sub-standard of accommodation, to the detriment of the residential amenities of future occupiers of the site. As such the proposal is contrary to policies D4 (Delivering good design and D6 (Housing quality and standards) of the London Plan 2021, policies LP1 (Design Quality and Local Character), LP2 (Development and Amenity) and LP17 (Housing Design) of the Hackney Local Plan 2020 and the recommendations of the Supplementary Planning Guidance: Housing 2016.</p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-9702e935-7fff-db81-821f-b9f03f325444"><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">The proposal, by reason of its location in a backland site without direct access to the public highway, would not represent a suitable or sustainable form of development and would fail to respect the pattern of development in the area, to the detriment of the character and appearance of the area and the principles of good design and sustainable development. As such the proposal is contrary to Policies D3, D4, D5 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), and Policies LP1, LP12 and LP17 of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 (2020).</span></span></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-d1fa118a-7fff-78ca-b12a-11b409bb4b8e"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:10.5pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">By reason of the proposed outbuilding’s detailed design, in particular its scale, proportions and materiality, would result in a dominant and incongruous form of development which would compromise the openness of the rear gardens which contribute positively to the significance of the setting of the Conservation Area. The harm caused would be detrimental</span><span style="white-space-collapse: preserve; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent;"> to the character and appearance and that of the visual interests of its surroundings. As such, the proposal would neither preserve or enhance the character or appearance of the </span><span style="white-space-collapse: preserve; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent;">Lordship Park</span><span style="white-space-collapse: preserve; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent;"> Conservation Area and would therefore conflict with Policies D1, D3, D4 &amp; HC1 of The London Plan (2021), Policy LP1 &amp; LP3 of the Hackney Local Plan LP33 (2020) and the Council’s Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD.</span></p>

<p>The proposed development, in the absence of a legal agreement to secure car-free housing, would be likely to promote the use of non-sustainable modes of transport and contribute to air pollution and congestion in the surrounding area, contrary to policies T6&nbsp;of the London Plan (2021), policy LP45 of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 (2020) and Hackney's S106 Planning Contributions SPD (2020).</p>

<p>The proposed development, in the absence of a legal agreement to contribute towards the Carbon Offset Fund,&nbsp; would fail to meet the London Objective of being a zero-carbon city by 2050, contrary to Policies SI 2 of the London Plan (2021), Policy&nbsp;&nbsp;LP55 of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 (2020) and Hackney's S106 Planning Contributions SPD (2020).</p>

<p>Insufficient information has been provided to demonstrate how a 10% biodiversity net gain will be achieved on the site contrary to policy G6 (Biodiversity and Access to Nature) of the London Plan (2021), policy LP47 (Biodiversity and Sites of Importance of Nature Conservation) of Hackney’s Local Plan 2033 (2020) and Schedule 7A of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (inserted by the Environment Act 2021).</p>
description: Erection of annexe (plus basement level) for ancillary use to the main dwelling .
